name: processed_timestamp
description: Timestamp of when the data was processed

name: data_split
description: The indication of whether the row should be used for TRAINING, VALIDATION or TESTING

name: feature_date
description: The date serving as basis for the features calculation

name: user_pseudo_id
description: The user pseudo identifier

name: user_id
description: The user identifier of when the user has logged in

name: device_category
description: The device category of the user last used to access

name: device_mobile_brand_name
description: The device mobile brand name last used by the user

name: geo_city
description: The geographic city from the user last access

name: geo_metro
description: The geographic metropolitan area from the user user last access

name: first_traffic_source_source
description: The first traffic source source from where the user was acquired

name: has_signed_in_with_user_id
description: A boolean indicating whether the user has signed in with the user id

description: The number of times the user has added items to cart in the last 30 to 60 days

name: add_to_carts_past_60_90_day
description: The number of times the user has added items to cart in the last 60 to 90 days

name: ltv_revenue_past_1_30_day
description: The user lifetime value revenue in the last 1 to 30 days

name: ltv_revenue_past_30_90_day
description: The user lifetime value revenue in the last 30 to 90 days

name: ltv_revenue_past_90_180_day
description: The user lifetime value revenue in the last 90 to 180 days

name: lifetime_purchasers_users
description: The number of distinct users who have purchases in the lifetime

name: lifetime_average_daily_purchasers
description: The average number of purchasers across all the days in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_active_users
description: The number of distinct users who visited your website or application in the user lifetime. An active user is any user who has an engaged session or when Analytics collects: the first_visit event or engagement_time_msec parameter from a website the first_open event or engagement_time_msec parameter from an Android app the first_open or user_engagement event from an iOS app

name: lifetime_DAU
description: The average number of users who engaged for the calendar day in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_MAU
description: The average number of users who engaged in the last 30 days in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_WAU
description: The average number of users who engaged in the last week in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_dau_per_mau
description: Daily Active Users (DAU) / Monthly Active Users (MAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged for the calendar day out of the users who engaged in the last 30 days in the user lifetime. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention

name: lifetime_dau_per_wau
description: Daily Active Users (DAU) / Weekly Active Users (WAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged in the last 24 hours out of the users who engaged in the last 7 days in the user lifetime. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention

name: lifetime_wau_per_mau
description: Weekly Active Users (DAU) / Monthly Active Users (MAU) shows the percentage of users who engaged in the last 7 days out of the users who engaged in the last 30 days in the user lifetime. A higher ratio suggests good engagement and user retention

name: lifetime_users_engagement_duration_seconds
description: The average length of time that your app screen was in the foreground or your web page was in focus in seconds in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_average_engagement_time
description: The average time that your website was in focus in a user's browser or an app was in the foreground of a user's device in the user lifetime. Average engagement time = total user engagement durations / number of active users

name: lifetime_average_engagement_time_per_session
description: The average engagement time per session in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_average_sessions_per_user
description: The average number of sessions per user in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_ARPPU
description: Average revenue per paying user (ARPPU) is the total purchase revenue per active user who made a purchase in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_ARPU
description: Average revenue per active user (ARPU) is the total revenue generated on average from each active user, whether they made a purchase or not in the user lifetime. ARPU = (Total ad revenue + purchase revenue + in-app purchase revenue + subscriptions) / Active users

name: lifetime_average_daily_revenue
description: The average total revenue for a day over the user lifetime

name: lifetime_max_daily_revenue
description: The maximum total revenue for a day over the user lifetime

name: lifetime_min_daily_revenue
description: The minimum total revenue for a day over the user lifetime

name: lifetime_new_users
description: The number of new unique user IDs that logged the first_open or first_visit event in the user lifetime. The metric allows you to measure the number of users who interacted with your site or launched your app for the first time

name: lifetime_returning_users
description: The number of users who have initiated at least one previous session, regardless of whether or not the previous sessions were engaged sessions in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_first_time_purchasers
description: The number of users who made their first purchase in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_first_time_purchaser_conversion
description: The percentage of active users who made their first purchase in the user lifetime. This metric is returned as a fraction; for example, 0.092 means 9.2% of active users were first-time purchasers

name: lifetime_first_time_purchasers_per_new_user
description: The average number of first-time purchasers per new user in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_avg_user_conversion_rate
description: The average number of converting user per total users in the user lifetime

name: lifetime_avg_session_conversion_rate
description: The average number of converting session per total sessions in the user lifetime

name: pltv_revenue_30_days
description: The predicted lifetime value revenue in the next 30 days
